thread.title: Ahmed Mohamed, the Boy Who Built a Clock, Is Moving to Qatar
thread.title_full: Ahmed Mohamed, the Boy Who Built a Clock, Is Moving to Qatar - US News

author: USNews
title: Ahmed Mohamed, the Boy Who Built a Clock, Is Moving to Qatar
text:
Ahmed Mohamed Is Moving to Qatar Mohamed, 14, was arrested last month when his school thought his clock was a hoax bomb. Ahmed Mohamed, the 14-year-old who was arrested at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas for allegedly bringing a hoax bomb to school, is moving to Qatar.
 13 p.m. EDT + More DALLAS (AP) â€” The family of a 14-year-old Muslim boy from Texas who was arrested after a homemade clock he brought to school was mistaken for a possible bomb has announced he'll be attending school in the Middle East.
Ahmed Mohamed's family said in a statement Tuesday they've accepted a foundation's offer to pay for his high school and college in Doha, Qatar. He recently visited the country as part of a whirlwind month that included a visit Monday to the White House.
Ahmed's father, Mohamed Elhassan Mohamed, told The Dallas Morning News that "we are going to move to a place where my kids can study and learn and all of them being accepted by that country."
Ahmed was arrested last month after bringing the clock to his high school in Irving, a Dallas suburb.
___
This story has been corrected to show that Ahmed went to high school in Irving and to correct a word in the father's Quote: from 'plan' to 'place.'
Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.
